content: stitch single_crochet 20 2 single_crochet in last stitch 24 row 24 ​ chain 1 single_crochet 24 24 to create the border without fastening off or cutting yarn single_crochet in the end of each row beginning at the top left of the triangle where you finished the last row this amounts to 23 single_crochet to get you to the tip of the triangle 3 single_crochet in the first stitch to turn the corner i usually stop here to pull the yarn tight from my first stitch and crochet over it as i continue single_crochet in the end of each row back up to the top right corner another 23 single_crochet slip_stitch to join to the first stitch of row 24 fasten_off to assemble banner *instructions here are completely customizable you can make the chains as long or as short as you like to get the look you desire instructions below are what i used for the piece pictured above chain 20 single_crochet in each stitch across the top of your first triangle crochet from the right corner to the left so you go over the yarn end from the border of your triangle *chain 10 single_crochet in each stitch across the top of your next triangle* repeat * to * until you have attached all triangles chain 21 turn and slip_stitch in the b​ ack loop ​ of your chain beginning in the 2nd chain from the hook when you get to the triangles slip_stitch in the single_crochet you did previously continue to slip_stitch until you reach the beginning of your chain fasten_off weave in ends other ways to customize i specifically chose to make my pieces 24 row long so that i had many ways to add stripes you could easily do stripes every 2 4 or 6 row or even add a single stripe in the middle that is 4 row wide i have also made some pieces with a button hole in the corner simply by adding a chain of 8 stitches after i complete the border then i add a button to the opposite corner and your banner is now a mix and match pattern you can swap out single pieces or reorder the colours as you choose thanks for choosing this pattern please tag me @​ rose_and_redwood​ on instagram or facebook and use the hashtag ​#crochetbuntingbanner ​ if you have any photos to share i d love to see everyone s design choices here are
